message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with the problem of recovering detailed human body shapes from a single image, which is a common task in computer vision and graphics. The proposed method uses deep neural networks and hierarchical mesh deformation to refine the 3D shape, which involves techniques from computer vision, machine learning, and graphics. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). 

The paper also utilizes body joints, silhouettes, and per-pixel shading information to constrain the shape estimation, which involves techniques from computer graphics and geometry processing. Therefore, the paper may also belong to cs.GR (Computer Graphics) and cs.MM (Multimedia). 

Moreover, the paper proposes a novel learning-based framework that combines the robustness of parametric model with the flexibility of free-form 3D deformation, which involves techniques from machine learning and optimization. Therefore, the paper may also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence).
